20110106010036.000|20110106010038.000|TR0|breaking medical story.  A dramatic 
20110106010038.000|20110106010040.000|TR0|development that impacts millions of 
20110106010040.000|20110106010042.000|TR0|parents.  The infamous study that spread 
20110106010042.000|20110106010045.000|TR0|fear among parents reported to show a link 
20110106010045.000|20110106010047.000|TR0|between autism and vaccinations is now 
20110106010047.000|20110106010049.000|TR0|being called a deliberate fraud.
20110106010049.000|20110106010051.000|TR0|
20110106010051.000|20110106010053.000|TR0|Not just bad science, but fraud.  A report

20110106010055.000|20110106010057.000|TR0|Journal' states unequivocally that, quote,

20110106010101.000|20110106010104.000|TR0|vaccine square."

20110106010129.000|20110106010131.000|TR0|
20110106010131.000|20110106010133.000|TR0|GUPTA:  It's a big deal.  This was the 
20110106010133.000|20110106010135.000|TR0|first time they actually looked at the 
20110106010135.000|20110106010137.000|TR0|study, which was a really small study to 
20110106010137.000|20110106010139.000|TR0|begin with. Just 12 patients, 12 children. 
20110106010139.000|20110106010142.000|TR0| And they found that not only was the 
20110106010142.000|20110106010144.000|TR0|data, the way it was collected, unethical. 
20110106010144.000|20110106010146.000|TR0| That charge had already been made.  What 
20110106010146.000|20110106010148.000|TR0|they found was that it was absolutely 
20110106010148.000|20110106010150.000|TR0|inaccurate and that those inaccuracies 
20110106010150.000|20110106010152.000|TR0|were done intentionally.
20110106010152.000|20110106010154.000|TR0|
20110106010154.000|20110106010156.000|TR0|Meaning that the actual information could 
20110106010156.000|20110106010158.000|TR0|have been found, it was available, that 
20110106010158.000|20110106010201.000|TR0|was ignored and instead essentially 
20110106010201.000|20110106010203.000|TR0|fabricated information was put in there.  
20110106010203.000|20110106010205.000|TR0|A couple of examples, real quick. Twelve 
20110106010205.000|20110106010207.000|TR0|patients, they said that the patients 
20110106010207.000|20110106010209.000|TR0|would get the vaccine and develop symptoms 
20110106010209.000|20110106010211.000|TR0|within a few days afterwards.
20110106010211.000|20110106010213.000|TR0|
20110106010213.000|20110106010215.000|TR0|In one of the patients, they found that in 
20110106010215.000|20110106010217.000|TR0|fact the child had symptoms prior to ever 
20110106010217.000|20110106010220.000|TR0|getting the vaccine.  Absolutely false. 
20110106010220.000|20110106010222.000|TR0|There's just no equivocating about that.  
20110106010222.000|20110106010224.000|TR0|And another other patient, they said the 
20110106010224.000|20110106010226.000|TR0|same thing.  Developed symptoms a couple 
20110106010226.000|20110106010228.000|TR0|of days after. In fact, it was six months 
20110106010228.000|20110106010230.000|TR0|later which obviously greatly diminishes 
20110106010230.000|20110106010232.000|TR0|the likelihood that it was related to the 
20110106010232.000|20110106010234.000|TR0|vaccine.
20110106010234.000|20110106010236.000|TR0|

20110106010428.000|20110106010430.000|TR0|rates dropped below 80 percent.  Now what

20110106010740.000|20110106010743.000|TR0|answer.  I think it's both the things that

20110106010835.000|20110106010837.000|TR0|research.  Really looking at what -- you 
20110106010837.000|20110106010840.000|TR0|know, you can, you know, sequence

20110106010848.000|20110106010850.000|TR0|

20110106010924.000|20110106010926.000|TR0|Oregon is JB Handley.  JB is a parent of 
20110106010926.000|20110106010928.000|TR0|an 8-year-old with autism and he's a

20110106010930.000|20110106010932.000|TR0|believes there is a connection between
